title: Unable to install heroku core plugins, git
body:

npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.10240
npm ERR! node v4.1.1

title: npm not recognised - > npm.cmd works
body:
Hi

I tried installing nodejs in windows 8 machine. The node got installed successfully.
But when i type in npm in the command line. It shows the below error:

npm is not recognised as internal or external command.
I have also set the PATh variable to "C:\Program Files\nodejs" where the nodejs is installed.

But it works when i type in npm.cmd. It shows the help options of npm.
How can i use npm instead of npm.cmd?
Installed : node-v0.12.6-x64.msi
Kindly help.

Regards
Preethi

title: Use "table" package instead of "text-table"
body:
https://github.com/gajus/table package is a very modular, well documented and well tested module/function for generating text tables. It allows granular customisation of how table contents is aligned, text wrapping, text truncation, border style and text padding.

If accepted, I will happily create a PR.

title: Errors updating npm on windows - path error?
body:
Hi, when doing ```npm update -g``` on Windows (8 & 10), I get a repeating error:

```
npm ERR! Cannot find module 'C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Roaming\nvm\v0.12.7\node_modules\npm\lib/build.js'                            
npm ERR!                                                                                                                           
npm ERR! If you need help, you may report this error at:                                                                           
npm ERR!     <https://github.com/npm/npm/issues>                                                                                   
npm ERR! Windows_NT 6.3.9600                                                                                                       
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "update" "-g"
npm ERR! node v0.12.7                                                                                                              
npm ERR! npm  v2.11.3                                                                                                              
npm ERR! code MODULE_NOT_FOUND                                                                                                     
```

I'm also using nvm to allow development on different node versions.

Looks like the issue is an incorrectly formed path - probably someone assuming everything happens on Linux! Note the second line down with ```lib/build.js```.

I think that the hard coded path should be replaced with a path.join

title: install: Update --only option to install only the argument env regardless of the NODE_ENV
body:
Hello! I just try to fix #9463. Here is the condition of setting the value of the development / production option.

## npm install
+ dev: true
+ prod: true

## --only=dev
+ dev: true
+ prod: false

## --only=prod || NODE_ENV=production
+ dev: false
+ prod: true

Thanks.

title: Recursive install ignoring commit(ish)
body:
We're testing some updated plugins in our code, as a result we have some `package.json` files targetting specific branches and commits so we can trial the new features. When running `npm install` in the parent folder all dependencies are installed, but the commitish sometimes gets ignored and reverts to master branch HEAD.

We have tried clearing the npm cache, manually deleting the `node_modules` folder, only way we can get the correct dependency version is to navigate to the relevant sub node_module folder and run an `npm install` from there.

Any ideas welcomed.

title: Add node 4.0 and 4.1 to TravisCI
body:
There are a few other PRs like this, and I apologize for duplicating - let's count them as +1s

I also have one question for discussion: should `iojs` be removed from the versions tested against? If my understanding's correct, it's no longer supported and folks should move to 4.x?

title: Node installer - version of npm
body:
Hello everybody's npm,


Yesterday (01.10.2015) I installed the latest version of [node js](https://nodejs.org/en/) 4.1.1 on windows, and the version of npm that was installed was the 2.14.x. But the version that is as release is already 3.3.4.

I had to use the command:   ``> npm npm install -g`` to update.


No errors, but I believe (as a suggestion) would be interesting node install the latest version of npm, especially in the windows, which had that problem very long paths, thus ensures better use of npm.


Thank you.

title: Use native-builder instead of node-gyp
body:
Hi there!
A small feature request / debate.

My team and I are working on a project named [native-builder](https://github.com/nachos/native-builder) :hammer: 

What it basically does is help native modules developer build their projects to what ever engine the package needs to be build for.

For example,
Your building a project running under [electron](http://electron.atom.io/).
Package `A` is a native package.
Package `B` is not a native package but it depends on package `A`.

When you install package `B` you need to know that it has a dependency on package 'A',
So something like this
``` bash
npm i
cd node_nodules/B/node_modules/A
HOME=~/.electron-gyp node-gyp rebuild --target 0.30.0 --dist-url=https://atom.io/download/atom-shell
```

To solve this problem we came up with native-builder that uses node-gyp and supports nw and electron.
However to [use it](https://github.com/nachos/native-builder#installation) you must:
*  Add this package as a dependency
``` bash
$ [sudo] npm install native-builder --save
```
* Add an install script
``` json 
{
  ...
  "scripts": {
    "install": "native-builder build"
  }
}
```

What if the defualt install script in npm would use native-builder instead?
It would solve this problem, for every package, immediatly.

So what do you think? :smile: 

P.S.
I am more than willing to start working on a pull request.
Also there is some work left on our package as well.

title: Error: Refusing to delete - OS X 10.11, npm @3.3.5, node @4.1.0 (works with npm @2.14.6)
body:
## Description

For some reason this seems to work with `npm` `@2.14.6` but fails when using `npm` `@3.3.5`.

## System Info

- OS X 10.11 (fresh install)
- nvm 0.27.1
    - node @4.1.0
    - npm @3.3.5

## Steps to reproduce

- Visit https://github.com/sindresorhus/electron-boilerplate
- Grab the boilerplate using `curl` command:

```
    $ curl -fsSL https://github.com/sindresorhus/electron-boilerplate/archive/master.tar.gz | tar -xz --strip-components 2
```

#### Using npm@3.3.5 (fails)

- Run `npm cache clean && rm -rf ./node_modules` (just to be safe)
- Run `npm install`
- Run `npm run build`
- Error occurs

#### Using npm@2.14.6 (succeeds)

- Run `npm cache clean && rm -rf ./node_modules` (just to be safe)
- Run `npm install`
- Run `npm run build`
- Everything works!

title: npm install runs node-gyp if any .gyp file is present
body:
The documented behavior of `npm install` is that it runs node-gyp if there is a `binding.gyp` file (the docs actually say `bindings.gyp` but I think that's a typo). But if there's *any* .gyp file in the project directory, it attempts to run `node-gyp rebuild`, even if none of them is called `binding.gyp`. This then fails since `binding.gyp` doesn't exist.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an empty project.
2. Create a file called `bogus.gyp` in the project root.
3. Run `npm install`.

Expected behavior: successful `npm install` without attempting to run `node-gyp`.

Observed behavior `npm install` attempts to run `node-gyp`, which fails because it cannot find `binding.gyp`.

**Edit**: I tested this with io.js 3.0.0.
